name: statedly
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
used when something has been stated (= said or written) to be true, or when something is said to have been done, but has not been proved: The article, statedly based on the book, points out that China has dominance in the huge toy market. Of the states with similar laws, only Indiana's and South Carolina's statedly apply to corporations.
mainly US old-fashioned in a way that is fixed or regular: I had planned to attend the meetings statedly five times during the winter, but I find it impossible to keep appointments. Whatever happens statedly in certain circumstances, we tend to call natural.
More examplesFewer examplesStatedly its preferred choice, Seattle will remain the company's headquarters city. The company has fixed the accounts which were statedly disabled due to errors during scheduled maintenance.They have not statedly resided in this state for three years.
